name: ACD
def: Adjournment In Contemplation Of Dismissal: to adjourn a case for 6 months with the ultimate aim of dismissing it WITHOUT a conviction

name: acknowledgment
def: a written declaration made before an authorized officer that the person executed the instument feely

name: adjournment
def: to postpone a case to a future date, a continuance

name: administrator
def: person, usually appointed by a surrogate court judge, to administer the affairs a deceased person when the person died without a will

name: affidavit
def: a signed written statement that is sworn to be true to the best knowledge of the person signing it

name: allegation
def: statement that is yet to be proven

name: allocution
def: a Judge's address on the record to determine whether parties understand the proposed settlement (stipulation)

name: annul
def: to make void or to cancel

name: appeal
def: an appelant asks a higher court to review the transcript of the proceeding with the aim of modifying or overturning the order or judgment

name: appearance
def: the official noting (oral or written) that a person is coming into court as a party in the action or as the attorney for a party

name: appelant
def: the person who appeals the order or judgment

name: appellee
def: the respondent in the appeal (the one who did not file the notice of appeal)

name: application
def: a request to a judge (the court)

name: arbitrator
def: a person (usually an attorney) appointed by the court to either look into an issue or decide an issue

name: arraignment
def: the criminal court process of informing the defendant of the charges asking how he pleads and deciding amount of bail, if any, that will be required

name: attach
def: is the formal process of using a court order to seize personal or real property

name: bail
def: the ammount of bail (deposit of money or property) is set by the criminal judge at arraignment to release the prisoner and guarantee his return on the next court date

name: beyond a reasonable doubt
def: the measure of proof needed to prove a criminal case (proof that is greater than the reasonable doubt that a juror might have)

name: brief
def: written statement submitted by a lawyer to the Judge containing legal arguments supporting his conclusions

name: calendar
def: list of cases scheduled to be heard by the court

name: cause of action
def: a specific reason for which an action is started (Example: damages to auto)

name: certification
def: to certify (state on a paper with the court seal) that the attached copy of a document has been compared to the original and is a true copy

name: chattel
def: personal property like a car, as opposed to real property (land or buildings)

name: codicil
def: a document attached to a will and forming a part of the will

name: common law
def: English law that developed from custom

name: complaint
def: (Civil) The written reasons for which damages are sought. (Criminal) Allegations made to a police or peace officer charging breaches of criminal law.

name: concurrent sentence
def: A sentence for an offense that may be served concurrently (at the same time) as a sentence for a different offense

name: consanguinity
def: a person may be related to another by consanguinity (blood) or by affinity (frienship)

name: consecutive sentence
def: a sentence for an offense that must be served successively (not at the same time) as a sentence for a different offense

name: conviction
def: a person is convicted if he is found guilty of an offense

name: count
def: an individual charge in an indictment

name: counterclaim
def: defendants's claim against the plaintiff

name: crime
def: a misdemeanor or a felony

name: deadly weapon
def: any instument (including a gun) that may cause serious physical injury or death

name: default
def: failure of a party to appear (default in judgment)

name: de novo
def: to have a new trial 'from the geginning'

name: DCJS
def: Division of Criminal Justice Services (does the fingerprint checks)

name: decision
def: the judge's ruling at the end of a case

name: defendant
def: the person being sued in a civil case or the person charged with committing an offense in a criminal case

name: deposition
def: answers to oral questions done under oath

name: dismissal
def: a judicial order disposing of a motion or without trial

name: executor
def: party appointed in a will to handle the affairs of the deceased according to the terms listed in the will

name: ex parte
def: proceeding done with only one party (ex parte request)

name: felony
def: an offence for which a term of imprisonment over one year may be imposed

name: garnish
def: to seize (attach) wage or other property based on an unpaid judgment

name: general verdict
def: in one in which the judge or jury finds in favor of plaintiff or defendant

name: grand jury
def: composed of 23 citizens who decide whether to indict (charge) a person with a felony and go to trial

name: guardian ad litem
def: a person (usually an attorney) appointed by the judge to represent the interests of a minor or incompenet during the course of a civil proceeding

name: haveas corpus
def: an instrument ordering that a person unlawfully imprisoned be brought to court for a hearing

name: indictment
def: the formal accusation by a grand jury which charges a person with committing a crime (misdemeanr or felony). Also known as a 'true bill'

name: infant's compromise
def: civil proceeding for court approval of settlement in a case involving an infant

name: information
def: a type of criminal complaint

name: injunction
def: an order by the court ordering someone to do an act or refrain from doing an act

name: inquest
def: trial with only one party appearing

name: jurisdiction
def: authority of a court to try certain types of cases (jurisdiction over matrimonial cases) or the authority of a court to try cases within a prescribed geographical area (county, state, etc.)

name: jury
def: a group of citizens selected to decide a civil or criminal case

name: lien
def: a legal right on personal or real property because of an unpaid debt or other reason

name: lis pendens
def: a pending lawsuit (Example, notice of lis pendens - notice that a lawsuit is pending having to do with the right to real property)

name: in camera
def: not in the courtroom, but in judge's chamber
